title: araise Package Manager
description: A cross-platform CLI for managing and running software packages with ease.
longDescription: araise Package Manager is a cross-platform tool that simplifies installation, management, and execution of software packages. It supports  Linux, and macOS with verified installation scripts and package integrity checks, ensuring security and simplicity for developers and power users alike.
features: Cross-platform support for Linux, and macOS
Secure installation with script verification
Built-in dependency management and signature checks
User-friendly CLI for installing, uninstalling, and running packages
Community-driven package contributions

installCommands.command: We do not support Windows, Please use WSL to use araise
installCommands.description: Install araise CLI on Windows using WSL

title: YSB
description: A Firefox extension that blocks YouTube Shorts for a distraction-free experience.
longDescription: YSB (YouTube Shorts Blocker) is a Firefox browser extension that automatically hides all YouTube Shorts from appearing in navigation, search, and recommendations. Designed to help users stay focused, it features a cyberpunk-inspired UI and a quick toggle to temporarily show Shorts for 30 seconds.
features: Automatically hides YouTube Shorts from homepage, search, and recommendations
Toggle to temporarily allow Shorts for 30 seconds
Cyberpunk-inspired interface with minimal UI
Lightweight and privacy-friendly — no tracking or data collection
MIT Licensed open-source project

installCommands.command: Go to about:debugging#/runtime/this-firefox → Load Temporary Add-on → select manifest.json

title: WTF-Tools
description: A collection of shell utilities to simplify debugging and improve developer workflow.
longDescription: WTF-Tools is a suite of shell utilities designed to boost developer productivity. It includes tools for logging, process monitoring, quick debugging, and automation. Each utility is lightweight, modular, and built for Linux and macOS terminals.
features: Developer-friendly CLI utilities for rapid debugging
Process monitoring and system status insights
Lightweight and modular shell design
Cross-platform support for Linux and macOS
Easily integrable with araise CLI

installCommands.command: git clone https://github.com/araise25/WTF-Tools.git && cd WTF-Tools && chmod +x install.sh && ./install.sh
git clone https://github.com/araise25/WTF-Tools.git && cd WTF-Tools && chmod +x install.sh && ./install.sh

title: Utility Kit
description: A stealth browser extension that closes a tab and wipes its trace.
longDescription: Utility Kit is a privacy-focused browser extension that lets you close a tab and erase its trace — as if it never existed. It hides under a generic name for stealth, supports renaming and hotkeys, and works on Chrome, Chromium, Edge, and Firefox browsers.
features: Close and forget: close a tab and remove its browsing history
Stealth mode: appears as 'Utility Kit' in extensions list
Renameable UI and custom icon for disguise
Hotkey support for quick close-and-erase action
Supports Chrome, Edge, and Firefox

installCommands.command: Go to chrome://extensions → enable Developer mode → Load unpacked → select `chrome_edition` folder
installCommands.description: Install Utility Kit for Chrome / Chromium browsers

installCommands.command: Go to about:debugging#/runtime/this-firefox → Load Temporary Add-on → select manifest.json in `firefox_edition` folder
